keywords.value: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: Scientists reported Monday that flooding in coastal communities was largely a result of greenhouse gas emissions, and likely to grow worse.

headline.print_headline: Greenhouse Gas Linked to Floods Along U.S. Coasts
headline.main: Seas Are Rising at Fastest Rate in Last 28 Centuries

snippet: Scientists reported Monday that flooding in coastal communities was largely a result of greenhouse gas emissions, and likely to grow worse.
abstract: Climate scientists report that tidal flooding in communities along United States coastline is largely result of rising seas connected to greenhouse gas emissions, and warn that problem will likely grow far worse in 22nd century and beyond; number of flood days in Charleston, SC, jumped from 34 in earlier decade to 219 in more recent, and in Key West, Fla, figure jumped from no flood days in earlier decade to 32 in more recent.
